So I was dumb enough to accidentally spend more than I needed to for the prestige kaisa skin (weird flex I know) My mates gave me a lotta shit for it which I had to laugh off because for $40 I could've gotten more better quality skins. Anywho lesson learned the thing I liked about the skin wasn't really the skin itself but the fact that u had to complete the missions everyday to get it. Like it was a reward for logging in every day and doing the missions which set it apart from the other skins since there was a grind you had to go through to get it. 
I'm all for prestige edition skins but I honestly feel like the yearly prestige edition skins are enough for the game. The problem with prestige skins for every event is that it kind of saturates the market and the skins have less value. Add the fact that you can 'unbox' the skins makes it feel as if the players who went and jumped over and through the hurdles to get the skins are hard done by. 
I'm not sure if this is a "cashgrab" like a lot of people seem to think it is and to be honest I don't really care but for me the first prestige skin was a way for me to play with a goal in mind. Sure it was a bit of an addiction for a few days, having to log in and put in a couple hours but at the end of it I got my skin and I was happy that I was rewarded for the dedication. 
In an ideal scenario prestige skins would be hard to get, exclusive (not unboxable or purchasable) and a reward for the people who put a lot of time to grind the game. I mean if you don't reward those people then wtf are you doing??
